@brief Application - is the application that is being Terminated

@brief Application - is the application that is being Paused
@brief Event arguments that passed via NUIApplicationResume signal
@brief Application - is the application that is being Resumed
@brief Event arguments that passed via NUIApplicationReset signal
@brief Application - is the application that is being Reset
@brief Event arguments that passed via NUIApplicationResize signal
@brief Application - is the application that is being Resized
@brief Event arguments that passed via NUIApplicationLanguageChanged signal
@brief Application - is the application that is being affected with Device's language change
@brief Event arguments that passed via NUIApplicationRegionChanged signal
@brief Application - is the application that is being affected with Device's region change
@brief Event arguments that passed via NUIApplicationBatteryLow signal
@brief Application - is the application that is being affected when the battery level of the device is low
@brief Event arguments that passed via NUIApplicationMemoryLow signal
@brief Application - is the application that is being affected when the memory level of the device is low
@brief Event arguments that passed via NUIApplicationAppControl signal
@brief Application - is the application that is receiving the launch request from another application
@brief VoidP - contains the information about why the application is launched
@brief Event for Initialized signal which can be used to subscribe/unsubscribe the event handler provided by the user. Initialized signal is emitted when application is initialised
@brief Event for Terminated signal which can be used to subscribe/unsubscribe the event handler provided by the user. Terminated signal is emitted when application is terminating
@brief Event for Paused signal which can be used to subscribe/unsubscribe the event handler provided by the user. Paused signal is emitted when application is paused
@brief Event for Resumed signal which can be used to subscribe/unsubscribe the event handler provided by the user. Resumed signal is emitted when application is resumed
@brief Event for Reset signal which can be used to subscribe/unsubscribe the event handler provided by the user. Reset signal is emitted when application is reset
@brief Event for Resized signal which can be used to subscribe/unsubscribe the event handler provided by the user. Resized signal is emitted when application is resized
@brief Event for LanguageChanged signal which can be used to subscribe/unsubscribe the event handler provided by the user. LanguageChanged signal is emitted when the region of the device is changed.
@brief Event for RegionChanged signal which can be used to subscribe/unsubscribe the event handler provided by the user. RegionChanged signal is emitted when the region of the device is changed.
@brief Event for BatteryLow signal which can be used to subscribe/unsubscribe the event handler provided by the user. BatteryLow signal is emitted when the battery level of the device is low.
@brief Event for MemoryLow signal which can be used to subscribe/unsubscribe the event handler provided by the user. MemoryLow signal is emitted when the memory level of the device is low.

@brief Event for AppControl signal which can be used to subscribe/unsubscribe the event handler provided by the user. AppControl signal is emitted when another application sends a launch request to the application.

@brief Image - is the image data that gets uploaded to GL.
3
@brief Event for Uploaded signal which can be used to subscribe/unsubscribe the event handler provided by the user. Uploaded signal is emitted when the image data gets uploaded to GL.

Note that the IEnumerator documentation requires an InvalidOperationException to be thrown whenever the collection is modified. This has been done for changes in the size of the collection, but not when one of the elements of the collection is modified as it is a bit tricky to detect unmanaged code that modifies the collection under our feet. 3

member.summary: Remove all layout children.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.LayoutGroup.GetChildMeasureSpec(Tizen.NUI.LayoutMeasureSpec,Tizen.NUI.LayoutLength,Tizen.NUI.LayoutLength)
member.summary: Calculate the right measure spec for this child. Does the hard part of MeasureChildren: figuring out the MeasureSpec to pass to a particular child. This method figures out the right MeasureSpec for one dimension (height or width) of one child view.
member.param: The padding of this view for the current dimension and margins, if applicable.
How big the child wants to be in the current dimension.
member.returns: a MeasureSpec for the child.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.LayoutGroup.OnMeasure(Tizen.NUI.LayoutMeasureSpec,Tizen.NUI.LayoutMeasureSpec)
member.summary:
Measure the layout and its content to determine the measured width and the measured height.
If this method is overridden, it is the subclass's responsibility to make sure the measured height and width are at least the layout's minimum height and width.
member.param: horizontal space requirements as imposed by the parent.
vertical space requirements as imposed by the parent.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.LayoutGroup.OnLayout(System.Boolean,Tizen.NUI.LayoutLength,Tizen.NUI.LayoutLength,Tizen.NUI.LayoutLength,Tizen.NUI.LayoutLength)
member.summary:
Called from Layout() when this layout should assign a size and position to each of its children.
Derived classes with children should override this method and call Layout() on each of their children.
member.param: This is a new size or position for this layout.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.LayoutGroup.OnSizeChanged(Tizen.NUI.LayoutSize,Tizen.NUI.LayoutSize)
member.summary: Virtual method to inform derived classes when the layout size changed.
member.param: The new size of the layout.
The old size of the layout.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.LayoutGroup.OnChildAdd(Tizen.NUI.LayoutItemWrapperImpl)
member.summary:
Callback when child is added to container.
Derived classes can use this to set their own child properties on the child layout's owner.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.LayoutGroup.OnChildRemove(Tizen.NUI.LayoutItemWrapperImpl)
member.summary: Callback when child is removed from container.

member.summary: Second stage initialization method for deriving classes to override.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.LayoutGroup.DoRegisterChildProperties(System.String)
member.summary: Method for derived classes to implement in order to register child property types with the container.
member.param: The fully qualified typename of the container.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.LayoutGroup.MeasureChildren(Tizen.NUI.LayoutMeasureSpec,Tizen.NUI.LayoutMeasureSpec)
member.summary:
Ask all of the children of this view to measure themselves, taking into account both the MeasureSpec requirements for this view and its padding.
The heavy lifting is done in GetChildMeasureSpec.
member.param: The width requirements for this view.
The height requirements for this view.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.LayoutGroup.MeasureChild(Tizen.NUI.LayoutItem,Tizen.NUI.LayoutMeasureSpec,Tizen.NUI.LayoutMeasureSpec)
member.summary:
Ask one of the children of this view to measure itself, taking into account both the MeasureSpec requirements for this view and its padding.
The heavy lifting is done in GetChildMeasureSpec.
member.param: The width requirements for this view.
The height requirements for this view.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.LayoutGroup.MeasureChildWithMargins(Tizen.NUI.LayoutItem,Tizen.NUI.LayoutMeasureSpec,Tizen.NUI.LayoutLength,Tizen.NUI.LayoutMeasureSpec,Tizen.NUI.LayoutLength)
member.summary:
Ask one of the children of this view to measure itself, taking into account both the MeasureSpec requirements for this view and its padding.
and margins. The child must have MarginLayoutParams The heavy lifting is done in GetChildMeasureSpec.
member.param: The width requirements for this view.
Extra space that has been used up by the parent horizontally (possibly by other children of the parent).
The height requirements for this view.
Extra space that has been used up by the parent vertically (possibly by other children of the parent).

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.LayoutGroupWrapperImpl
member.summary: Internal Layout class that all layout containers should derive from. Mirrors the native class LayoutGroup.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.LayoutItem.Unparent
member.summary: Unparent this layout from it's owner, and remove any layout children in derived types.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.LayoutItem.Measure(Tizen.NUI.LayoutMeasureSpec,Tizen.NUI.LayoutMeasureSpec)
member.summary:
This is called to find out how big a layout should be.
The parent supplies constraint information in the width and height parameters.
The actual measurement work of a layout is performed in OnMeasure called by this method. Therefore, only OnMeasure can and must be overridden by subclasses.
member.param: Horizontal space requirements as imposed by the parent.
Vertical space requirements as imposed by the parent.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.LayoutItem.Layout(Tizen.NUI.LayoutLength,Tizen.NUI.LayoutLength,Tizen.NUI.LayoutLength,Tizen.NUI.LayoutLength)
member.summary:
Assign a size and position to a layout and all of its descendants.
This is the second phase of the layout mechanism. (The first is measuring). In this phase, each parent calls layout on all of its children to position them. This is typically done using the child
measurements that were stored in the measure pass.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.LayoutItem.GetDefaultSize(Tizen.NUI.LayoutLength,Tizen.NUI.LayoutMeasureSpec)
member.summary:
Utility to return a default size.
Uses the supplied size if the MeasureSpec imposed no constraints. Will get larger if allowed by the MeasureSpec.
member.returns: The size this layout should be.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.LayoutItem.RequestLayout
member.summary:
Request that this layout is re-laid out.
This will make this layout and all it's parent layouts dirty.

member.summary: Predicate to determine if this layout has been requested to re-layout.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.LayoutItem.IsLayoutRequested
member.summary: Predicate to determine if this layout has been requested to re-layout.
member.returns: True if a layout request has occured on this layout.

Returns the suggested minimum height that the layout should use.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.LayoutItem.MinimumWidth
member.summary:
Sets the minimum width of the layout.
It is not guaranteed the layout will be able to achieve this minimum width (for example, if its parent layout constrains it with less available width).

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.LayoutItem.OnMeasure(Tizen.NUI.LayoutMeasureSpec,Tizen.NUI.LayoutMeasureSpec)
member.summary:
Measure the layout and its content to determine the measured width and the measured height.
The base class implementation of measure defaults to the background size, unless a larger size is allowed by the MeasureSpec. Subclasses should override to provide better measurements of their content.
If this method is overridden, it is the subclass's responsibility to make sure the measured height and width are at least the layout's minimum height and width.
member.param: horizontal space requirements as imposed by the parent.
vertical space requirements as imposed by the parent.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.LayoutItem.OnLayout(System.Boolean,Tizen.NUI.LayoutLength,Tizen.NUI.LayoutLength,Tizen.NUI.LayoutLength,Tizen.NUI.LayoutLength)
member.summary:
Called from Layout() when this layout should assign a size and position to each of its children.
Derived classes with children should override this method and call Layout() on each of their children.
member.param: This is a new size or position for this layout.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.Uint16Pair
member.summary:
Simple class for passing around pairs of small unsigned integers.
Use this for integer dimensions and points with limited range such as image sizes and pixel coordinates where a pair of floating point numbers is inefficient and illogical (i.e.the data is inherently integer).
One of these can be passed in a single 32 bit integer register on common architectures.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.Adaptor
member.summary:
An Adaptor object is used to initialize and control how Dali runs.
It provides the lifecycle interface that allows the application writer to provide their own main loop and other platform related features.
The Adaptor class provides a means for initialising the resources required by the Dali::Core.
When dealing with platform events, the application writer must ensure that DALi is called in a thread-safe manner.
As soon as the Adaptor class is created and started, the application writer can initialise their view objects straight away or as required by the main loop they intend to use (there is no need to wait for an initialize signal as per the Tizen.NUI.Application class).

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Adaptor.NotifyLanguageChanged
member.summary:
Calls this method to notify DALi when the system language changes.
Use this only when not using Dali::Application. As the application is created, using the application will automatically receive notification of the language change. When Dali::Application is not used, the application developer should use app-core to receive the language change notifications and should update DALi by calling this method.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.AlphaFunction
member.summary:
Alpha functions are used in animations to specify the rate of change of the animation parameter over time.
Understanding an animation as a parametric function over time, the alpha function is applied to the parameter of the animation before computing the final animation value.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.Animation
member.summary:
Animation can be used to animate the properties of any number of objects, typically view.
If the "Finished" event is connected to a member function of an object, it must be disconnected before the object is destroyed.
This is typically done in the object destructor, and requires either the animation handle to be stored.
The overall animation time is superseded by the values given in the animation time used when calling the AnimateTo(), AnimateBy(), AnimateBetween() and AnimatePath() methods.
If any of the individual calls to those functions exceeds the overall animation time (Duration), then the overall animation time is automatically extended.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Animation.Dispose(Tizen.NUI.DisposeTypes)
member.summary: To make animation instance be disposed.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Animation.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Creates an initialized animation.
The animation will not loop.
The default end action is "Cancel".
The default alpha function is linear.
member.remarks: DurationmSeconds must be greater than zero.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Animation.Duration
member.summary: Gets or sets the duration in milliseconds of the animation.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Animation.DefaultAlphaFunction
member.summary: Gets or sets the default alpha function for the animation.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Animation.State
member.summary: Queries the state of the animation.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Animation.LoopCount
member.summary:
Set: Enables looping for a specified number of repeats. A zero is the same as Looping = true; i.e., repeat forever.
This property resets the looping value and should not be used with the Looping property.
Setting this parameter does not cause the animation to Play().
Get: Gets the loop count. A zero is the same as Looping = true; i.e., repeat forever.
The loop count is initially 1 for play once.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Animation.Looping
member.summary:
Gets or sets the status of whether the animation will loop.
This property resets the loop count and should not be used with the LoopCount property.
Setting this parameter does not cause the animation to Play().

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Animation.EndAction
member.summary:
Gets or sets the end action of the animation.
This action is performed when the animation ends or if it is stopped.
The default end action is cancel.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Animation.Stop(Tizen.NUI.Animation.EndActions)
member.summary: Stops the animation.
member.param: The end action can be set.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Animation.CurrentLoop
member.summary:
Gets the current loop count.
A value 0 indicating the current loop count when looping.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Animation.DisconnectAction
member.summary:
Gets or sets the disconnect action.
If any of the animated property owners are disconnected from the stage while the animation is being played, then this action is performed.
The default action is cancel.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Animation.CurrentProgress
member.summary:
Gets or sets the progress of the animation.
The animation will play (or continue playing) from this point.
The progress must be in the 0-1 interval or in the play range interval if defined
otherwise, it will be ignored.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Animation.SpeedFactor
member.summary:
Gets or sets specificifications of a speed factor for the animation.
The speed factor is a multiplier of the normal velocity of the animation.
Values between [0, 1] will slow down the animation and values above one will speed up the animation.
It is also possible to specify a negative multiplier to play the animation in reverse.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Animation.PlayRange
member.summary:
Gets or sets the playing range.
Animation will play between the values specified. Both values (range.x and range.y ) should be between 0-1, otherwise they will be ignored. If the range provided is not in proper order (minimum, maximum ), it will be reordered.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Animation.ProgressNotification
member.summary:
Gets or sets the progress notification marker which triggers the ProgressReachedSignal.
Percentage of animation progress should be greater than 0 and less than 1, for example, 0.3 for 30%
One notification can be set on each animation.

The view will rotate to orient the supplied forward vector with the path's tangent.
If forward is the zero vector then no rotation will happen.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.CustomView.RelayoutRequest
member.summary:
Requests a relayout, which means performing a size negotiation on this view, its parent, and children (and potentially whole scene).
This method can also be called from a derived class every time it needs a different size.
At the end of event processing, the relayout process starts and all controls which requested relayout will have their sizes (re)negotiated.
It can be called multiple times; the size negotiation is still only performed once, i.e., there is no need to keep track of this in the calling side.

member.param: The child view to calculate the size for.

member.returns: Return the calculated size for the given dimension. If more than one dimension is requested, just return the first one found.

Registers a visual by the property index, linking a view to visual when required.
In the case of the visual being a view or control deeming visual not required, then the visual should be an empty handle.
If enabled is false, then the visual is not set on the stage until enabled by the derived class.
member.param: The property index of the visual used to reference visual.
False if derived class wants to control when the visual is set on the stage.

member.summary:
This method is called after the control has been initialized.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.CustomView.OnStageConnection(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Called after the view has been connected to the stage.
When a view is connected, it will be directly or indirectly parented to the root view.
The root view is provided automatically by Tizen.NUI.Stage, and is always considered to be connected.
When the parent of a set of views is connected to the stage, then all of the children will receive this callback.
member.param: The depth in the hierarchy for the view.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.CustomView.OnStageDisconnection
member.summary:
Called after the view has been disconnected from the stage.
If a view is disconnected, it either has no parent, or is parented to a disconnected view.
When the parent of a set of views is disconnected to the stage, then all of the children will receive this callback, starting with the leaf views.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.FlexContainer
member.summary:
FlexContainer implements a subset of the flexbox spec (defined by W3C):https://www.w3.org/TR/css3-flexbox/
It aims at providing a more efficient way to layout, align, and distribute space among items in the container, even when their size is unknown or dynamic.
FlexContainer has the ability to alter the width and the height of its children (i.e., flex items) to fill the available space in the best possible way on different screen sizes.
FlexContainer can expand items to fill available free space, or shrink them to prevent overflow.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.TableView
member.summary:
TableView is a layout container for aligning child actors in a grid like layout.
TableView constraints the X and the Y position and the width and the height of the child actors.
The Z position and depth are left intact so that the 3D model actors can also be laid out in a grid without loosing their depth scaling.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.TableView.SetRelativeHeight(System.UInt32,System.Single)
member.summary:
Sets a row to have a relative height. Relative height means percentage of the remainder of the table height after subtracting padding and fixed height rows.
Setting a relative height of 0 has no effect.

member.summary: Gets a row's relative height.

The width in world coordinate units.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.TableView.SetRelativeWidth(System.UInt32,System.Single)
member.summary:

This does not interfere with the view's scale factor.
The views default depth is the minimum of width and height.

member.summary:
Retrieves the size of the view.
The coordinates are relative to the view's parent.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.Opacity
member.summary: Retrieves and sets the view's opacity.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.Position2D
member.summary:
Sets the position of the view for X and Y.
By default, sets the position vector between the parent origin and the pivot point (default).
If the position inheritance is disabled, sets the world position.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.ScreenPosition
member.summary: Retrieves the screen postion of the view.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.PositionUsesPivotPoint
member.summary: Determines whether the pivot point should be used to determine the position of the view. This is true by default.
member.remarks: If false, then the top-left of the view is used for the position. Setting this to false will allow scaling or rotation around the anchor-point without affecting the view's position.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.HierarchyDepth
member.summary: Gets the depth in the hierarchy for the view.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.SiblingOrder
member.summary: Sets the sibling order of the view so the depth position can be defined within the same parent.
member.remarks: Note the initial value is 0. SiblingOrder should be bigger than 0 or equal to 0. Raise, Lower, RaiseToTop, LowerToBottom, RaiseAbove, and LowerBelow will override the sibling order. The values set by this property will likely change.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.NaturalSize2D
member.summary: Returns the natural size (Size2D) of the view.

member.summary: Set the layout on this control.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.Show
member.summary: Shows the view.
member.remarks: This is an asynchronous method.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.Hide
member.summary: Hides the view.
member.remarks: This is an asynchronous method. If the view is hidden, then the view and its children will not be rendered. This is regardless of the individual visibility of the children, i.e., the view will only be rendered if all of its parents are shown.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.RaiseToTop
member.summary: Raises the view above all other views.
member.remarks: Sibling order of views within the parent will be updated automatically. Once a raise or lower API is used, that view will then have an exclusive sibling order independent of insertion.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.LowerToBottom
member.summary: Lowers the view to the bottom of all views.
member.remarks: The sibling order of views within the parent will be updated automatically. Once a raise or lower API is used that view will then have an exclusive sibling order independent of insertion.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.IsResourceReady
member.summary: Queries if all resources required by a view are loaded and ready.
member.remarks: Most resources are only loaded when the control is placed on the stage.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.RaiseAbove(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View)
member.summary: Raises the view to above the target view.
member.remarks: The sibling order of views within the parent will be updated automatically. Views on the level above the target view will still be shown above this view. Raising this view above views with the same sibling order as each other will raise this view above them. Once a raise or lower API is used that view will then have an exclusive sibling order independent of insertion.
member.param: Will be raised above this view.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.LowerBelow(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View)
member.summary: Lowers the view to below the target view.
member.remarks: The sibling order of views within the parent will be updated automatically. Lowering this view below views with the same sibling order as each other will lower this view above them. Once a raise or lower API is used that view will then have an exclusive sibling order independent of insertion.
member.param: Will be lowered below this view.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.ParentOrigin
member.summary:
Gets or sets the origin of a view within its parent's area.
This is expressed in unit coordinates, such that (0.0, 0.0, 0.5) is the top-left corner of the parent, and (1.0, 1.0, 0.5) is the bottom-right corner.
The default parent-origin is ParentOrigin.TopLeft (0.0, 0.0, 0.5).
A view's position is the distance between this origin and the view's anchor-point.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.PivotPoint
member.summary:
Gets or sets the anchor-point of a view.
This is expressed in unit coordinates, such that (0.0, 0.0, 0.5) is the top-left corner of the view, and (1.0, 1.0, 0.5) is the bottom-right corner.
The default pivot point is PivotPoint.Center (0.5, 0.5, 0.5).
A view position is the distance between its parent-origin and this anchor-point.
A view's orientation is the rotation from its default orientation, the rotation is centered around its anchor-point.
The view has been initialized.

member.summary: Gets or sets the status of whether a child view inherits it's parent's orientation.

member.summary: Gets or sets the status of whether a child view inherits it's parent's scale.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.DrawMode
member.summary:
Gets or sets the status of how the view and its children should be drawn.
Not all views are renderable, but DrawMode can be inherited from any view.
If an object is in a 3D layer, it will be depth-tested against other objects in the world, i.e., it may be obscured if other objects are in front.
If DrawMode.Overlay2D is used, the view and its children will be drawn as a 2D overlay.
Overlay views are drawn in a separate pass, after all non-overlay views within the layer.
For overlay views, the drawing order is with respect to tree levels of views, and depth-testing will not be used.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.SizeModeFactor
member.summary:
Gets or sets the relative to parent size factor of the view.
This factor is only used when ResizePolicyType is set to either: ResizePolicyType.SizeRelativeToParent or ResizePolicyType.SizeFixedOffsetFromParent.
This view's size is set to the view's size multiplied by or added to this factor, depending on ResizePolicyType.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.InheritPosition
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether a child view inherits it's parent's position.
Default is to inherit.
Switching this off means that using position sets the view's world position, i.e., translates from the world origin (0,0,0) to the pivot point of the view.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.VisualView.OnRelayout(Tizen.NUI.Vector2,Tizen.NUI.RelayoutContainer)
member.summary:
Overrides the method of OnRelayout() for CustomView class.
Called after the size negotiation has been finished for this control.
The control is expected to assign this given size to itself or its children.
Should be overridden by derived classes if they need to layout actors differently after certain operations like add or remove actors, resize, or after changing specific properties.
member.remarks: As this function is called from inside the size negotiation algorithm, you cannot call RequestRelayout (the call would just be ignored).
member.param: The control should add actors to this container that it is not able to allocate a size for.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Container.Add(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View)
member.summary: Adds a child view to this Container.
member.pre: This Container (the parent) has been initialized. The child view has been initialized. The child view is not the same as the parent view.
member.post: The child will be referenced by its parent. This means that the child will be kept alive, even if the handle passed into this method is reset or destroyed.
member.remarks: If the child already has a parent, it will be removed from the old parent and reparented to this view. This may change child's position, color, scale, etc. as it now inherits them from this view.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Container.Remove(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View)
member.summary: Removes a child view from this view. If the view was not a child of this view, this is a no-op.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.CustomViewRegistry.Register(System.Func{Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.CustomView},System.Type)
member.summary:
The function which registers a view and all it's scriptable properties with DALi's type registry. Means the view can be created or configured from a JSON script.
The function uses introspection to scan a views C# properties, then selects the ones with [ScriptableProperty] attribute to be registered. Example of a Spin view registering itself: static Spin() { ViewRegistry registers control type with DALi type registery also uses introspection to find any properties that need to be registered with type registry ViewRegistry.Instance.Register(CreateInstance, typeof(Spin) ); }

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager
member.summary:
Provides the functionality of handling keyboard navigation and maintaining the two-dimensional keyboard focus chain.
It provides functionality of setting the focus and moving the focus in four directions( i.e., left, right, up, and down).
It also draws a highlight for the focused view and sends an event when the focus is changed.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.PreFocusChangeEventArgs
member.summary: Event arguments that passed via the PreFocusChange signal.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.PreFocusChangeEventArgs.CurrentView
member.summary: The current focus view.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.PreFocusChangeEventArgs.ProposedView
member.summary: The proposed view.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.PreFocusChangeEventArgs.Direction
member.summary: The focus move direction.

member.name: E:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.PreFocusChange
member.summary:
PreFocusChange will be triggered before the focus is going to be changed.
The FocusManager makes the best guess for which view to focus towards the given direction, but applications might want to change that.
By connecting with this event, they can check the proposed view to focus and return a different view if they wish.
This event is only triggered when the navigation key is pressed and KeyboardFocusManager tries to move the focus automatically.
It won't be emitted for focus movement by calling the SetCurrentFocusView directly.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.FocusChangedEventArgs
member.summary: Event arguments that passed via the FocusChanged signal.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.FocusChangedEventArgs.CurrentView
member.summary: The current focus view.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.FocusChangedEventArgs.NextView
member.summary: The next focus view.

member.name: E:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.FocusChanged
member.summary: The FocusGroupChanged will be triggered after the current focused view has been changed.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.FocusGroupChangedEventArgs
member.summary: Event arguments that passed via the FocusGroupChanged signal.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.FocusGroupChangedEventArgs.CurrentView
member.summary: The current focus view.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.FocusGroupChangedEventArgs.ForwardDirection
member.summary: The forward direction.

member.name: E:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.FocusGroupChanged
member.summary:
The FocusGroupChanged will be triggered when the focus group has been changed.
If the current focus group has a parent layout control, the FocusManager will make the best guess for the next focus group to move the focus to in the given direction (forward or backward).
If not, the application has to set the new focus.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.SetCurrentFocusView(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View)
member.summary:
Moves the keyboard focus to the given view.
Only one view can be focused at the same time.
The view must be in the stage already and keyboard focusable.
member.returns: Whether the focus is successful or not.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.GetCurrentFocusView
member.summary: Gets the current focused view.
member.returns: A handle to the current focused view or an empty handle if no view is focused.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.MoveFocus(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.FocusDirection)
member.summary: Moves the focus to the next focusable view in the focus chain in the given direction (according to the focus traversal order).
member.param: The direction of the focus movement.
member.returns: True if the movement was successful.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.ClearFocus
member.summary:
Clears the focus from the current focused view if any, so that no view is focused in the focus chain.
It will emit the FocusChanged event without the current focused view.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.MoveFocusBackward
member.summary: Move the focus to previous focused view.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.FocusGroupLoop
member.summary:
Gets or sets the status of whether the focus movement should be looped within the same focus group.
The focus movement is not looped by default.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.SetAsFocusGroup(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Sets whether the view is a focus group that can limit the scope of the focus movement to its child views in the focus chain.
Layout controls set themselves as focus groups by default.
member.param: The view to be set as a focus group.
Whether to set the view as a focus group or not.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.IsFocusGroup(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View)
member.summary: Checks whether the view is set as a focus group or not.
member.returns: Whether the view is set as a focus group.

member.summary: Returns the closest ancestor of the given view that is a focus group.
member.param: The view to be checked for its focus group.
member.returns: The focus group the given view belongs to or an empty handle if the given view.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.FocusIndicator
member.summary:
Gets or sets the focus indicator view.
This will replace the default focus indicator view in the FocusManager and will be added to the focused view as a highlight.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.SetCustomAlgorithm(Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.ICustomFocusAlgorithm)
member.summary: Provides the implementation of a custom focus algorithm interface to allow the application to define the focus logic.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.Instance
member.summary: Gets the singleton of the FocusManager object.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.ICustomFocusAlgorithm
member.summary:
ICustomFocusAlgorithm is used to provide the custom keyboard focus algorithm for retrieving the next focusable view.
The application can implement the interface and override the keyboard focus behavior.
If the focus is changing within a layout container, then the layout container is queried first to provide the next focusable view.
If this does not provide a valid view, then the Keyboard FocusManager will check focusable properties to determine the next focusable actor.
If focusable properties are not set, then the keyboard FocusManager calls the GetNextFocusableView() method of this interface.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.ICustomFocusAlgorithm.GetNextFocusableView(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View,Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View,Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.FocusDirection)
member.summary: Get the next focus actor.
member.returns: The next focus actor.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.Hover
member.summary:
Hover events are a collection of points at a specific moment in time.
When a multi-event occurs, each point represents the points that are currently being hovered or the points where a hover has stopped.

Returns the ID of the device used for the point specified.
Each point has a unique device ID which specifies the device used for that point. This is returned by this method.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ImfManager.Activate
member.summary:
Activates the IMF.
It means that the text editing is started somewhere.
If the hardware keyboard isn't connected, then it will show the virtual keyboard.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ImfManager.Deactivate
member.summary:
Deactivates the IMF.
It means that the text editing is finished somewhere.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ImfManager.RestoreAfterFocusLost
member.summary:
Gets the restoration status which controls if the keyboard is restored after the focus is lost and then regained.
If true, then the keyboard will be restored (activated) after focus is regained.
member.returns: The restoration status.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ImfManager.SetRestoreAfterFocusLost(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the status whether the IMF has to restore the keyboard after losing focus.
member.param: True means that keyboard should be restored after the focus is lost and regained.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ImfManager.Reset
member.summary: Sends a message reset to the preedit state or the IMF module.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ImfManager.NotifyCursorPosition
member.summary: Notifies the IMF context that the cursor position has changed, required for features like auto-capitalization.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ImfManager.SetCursorPosition(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Sets the cursor position stored in VirtualKeyboard, this is required by the IMF context.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ImfManager.GetCursorPosition
member.summary: Gets the cursor position stored in VirtualKeyboard, this is required by the IMF context.
member.returns: The current position of the cursor.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ImfManager.SetSurroundingText(System.String)
member.summary: A method to store the string required by the IMF, this is used to provide predictive word suggestions.
member.param: The text string surrounding the current cursor point.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ImfManager.GetSurroundingText
member.summary: Gets the current text string set within the IMF manager, this is used to offer predictive suggestions.
member.returns: The surrounding text.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ImfManager.NotifyTextInputMultiLine(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Notifies the IMF context that text input is set to multiline or not.
member.param: True if multiline text input is used.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ImfManager.GetTextDirection
member.summary: Returns the text direction of the keyboard's current input language.
member.returns: The direction of the text.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ImfManager.GetInputMethodArea
member.summary:
Provides the size and the position of the keyboard.
The position is relative to whether the keyboard is visible or not.
If the keyboard is not visible, then the position will be off the screen.
If the keyboard is not being shown when this method is called, the keyboard is partially setup (IMFContext) to get/> the values then taken down. So ideally, GetInputMethodArea() should be called after Show().
member.returns: Rectangle which is keyboard panel x, y, width, height.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ImfManager.SetInputPanelUserData(System.String)
member.summary: Sets up the input-panel specific data.
member.param: The specific data to be set to the input panel.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ImfManager.GetInputPanelUserData(System.String@)
member.summary: Gets the specific data of the current active input panel.
member.param: The specific data to be received from the input panel.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ImfManager.GetInputPanelState
member.summary: Gets the state of the current active input panel.
member.returns: The state of the input panel.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ImfManager.SetReturnKeyState(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Sets the return key on the input panel to be visible or invisible.
The default is true.
member.param: True if the return key is visible (enabled), false otherwise.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ImfManager.AutoEnableInputPanel(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables to show the input panel automatically when focused.
member.param: If true, the input panel will be shown when focused.

member.summary: Shows the input panel.

member.summary: Hides the input panel.

member.summary:
Gets the keyboard type.
The default keyboard type is SoftwareKeyboard.

member.summary:
Gets the current language locale of the input panel.
For example, en_US, en_GB, en_PH, fr_FR, ...
member.returns: The current language locale of the input panel.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.InputMethodContext.Activate
member.summary:
Activates the IMF.
It means that the text editing is started somewhere.
If the hardware keyboard isn't connected, then it will show the virtual keyboard.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.InputMethodContext.Deactivate
member.summary:
Deactivates the IMF.
It means that the text editing is finished somewhere.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.InputMethodContext.GetInputMethodArea
member.summary:
Provides the size and the position of the keyboard.
The position is relative to whether the keyboard is visible or not.
If the keyboard is not visible, then the position will be off the screen.
If the keyboard is not being shown when this method is called, the keyboard is partially setup (IMFContext) to get/> the values then taken down. So ideally, GetInputMethodArea() should be called after Show().
member.returns: Rectangle which is keyboard panel x, y, width, height.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.Layer.LayerBehavior
member.summary: Enumeration for the behavior of the layer.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.Layer.LayerBehavior.Layer2D
member.summary: UI control rendering mode.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.Layer.LayerBehavior.LayerUI
member.summary:
UI control rendering mode (default mode). This mode is designed for UI controls that can overlap. In this mode renderer order will be respective to the tree hierarchy of Actors.
The rendering order is depth first, so for the following actor tree, A will be drawn first, then B, D, E, then C, F. This ensures that overlapping actors are drawn as expected (whereas, with breadth first traversal, the actors would interleave).

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.Layer.LayerBehavior.Layer3D
member.summary:
Layer will use depth test. This mode is designed for a 3 dimensional scene where actors in front of other actors will obscure them, i.e. the actors are sorted by the distance from the camera.
When using this mode, a depth test will be used. A depth clear will happen for each layer, which means actors in a layer "above" other layers will be rendered in front of actors in those layers regardless of their Z positions (see Layer::Raise() and Layer::Lower()).
Opaque renderers are drawn first and write to the depth buffer. Then transparent renderers are drawn with depth test enabled but depth write switched off. Transparent renderers are drawn based on their distance from the camera. A renderer's DEPTH_INDEX property is used to offset the distance to the camera when ordering transparent renderers. This is useful if you want to define the draw order of two or more transparent renderers that are equal distance from the camera. Unlike LAYER_UI, parent-child relationship does not affect rendering order at all.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Layer.Behavior
member.summary: Layer behavior, type String (Layer.LayerBehavior).

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Layer.ClippingEnabled
member.summary: Internal only property to enable or disable clipping, type boolean. By default, this is false, i.e., the viewport of the layer is the entire window.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Layer.Viewport
member.summary: Sets the viewport (in window coordinates), type rectangle. The contents of the layer will not be visible outside this box, when ViewportEnabled is true.

member.summary: Retrieves and sets the layer's opacity.

This is the point, in screen coordinates, where the long press occurred.

member.summary:
This is the point, in local actor coordinates, where the long press occurred.
If a multi-touch long press, then this is the centroid of all the touch points.

This specifies SpreadMethod types.
SpreadMethod defines what happens if the gradient starts or ends inside the bounds of the target rectangle.

member.summary: Uses the terminal colors of the gradient to fill the remainder of the quad.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.GradientVisualSpreadMethodType.Reflect
member.summary: Reflects the gradient pattern start-to-end, end-to-start, start-to-end, etc. until the quad is filled.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.GradientVisualSpreadMethodType.Repeat
member.summary: Repeats the gradient pattern start-to-end, start-to-end, start-to-end, etc. until the quad is filled.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.FittingModeType
member.summary:
This specifies fitting mode types. Fitting options, used when resizing images to fit desired dimensions.
A fitting mode controls the region of a loaded image to be mapped to the desired image rectangle.
All fitting modes preserve the aspect ratio of the image contents.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.FittingModeType.ShrinkToFit
member.summary: Full-screen image display: Limit loaded image resolution to device resolution using the ShrinkToFit mode.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.FittingModeType.ScaleToFill
member.summary: Thumbnail gallery grid: Limit loaded image resolution to screen tile using the ScaleToFill mode.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.FittingModeType.FitWidth
member.summary: Image columns: Limit loaded image resolution to column width using the FitWidth mode.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.FittingModeType.FitHeight
member.summary: Image rows: Limit loaded image resolution to row height using the FitHeight mode.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.SamplingModeType
member.summary:
This specifies sampling mode types. Filtering options are used when resizing images to sample original pixels.
A SamplingMode controls how pixels in an input image are sampled and combined to generate each pixel of a destination image during scaling.
NoFilter and Box modes do not guarantee that the output pixel array exactly matches the rectangle specified by the desired dimensions and the FittingMode,
but all other filter modes do if the desired dimensions are not more than the raw dimensions of the input image file.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.SamplingModeType.Box
member.summary:
Iteratively box filter to generate an image of 1/2, 1/4, 1/8, etc. width and height and approximately the desired size.
This is the default.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.SamplingModeType.Nearest
member.summary: For each output pixel, read one input pixel.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.SamplingModeType.Linear
member.summary: For each output pixel, read a quad of four input pixels and write a weighted average of them.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.SamplingModeType.BoxThenNearest
member.summary:
Iteratively box filter to generate an image of 1/2, 1/4, 1/8, etc. width and height and approximately the desired size,
then for each output pixel, read one pixel from the last level of box filtering.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.SamplingModeType.BoxThenLinear
member.summary: Iteratively box filter to almost the right size, then for each output pixel, read four pixels from the last level of box filtering and write their weighted average.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.SamplingModeType.NoFilter
member.summary: No filtering is performed. If the SCALE_TO_FILL scaling mode is enabled, the borders of the image may be trimmed to match the aspect ratio of the desired dimensions.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.SamplingModeType.DontCare
member.summary: For caching algorithms where a client strongly prefers a cache-hit to reuse a cached image.

member.summary: Size of the visual, which can be either relative (percentage [0.0f to 1.0f] of the parent) or absolute (in world units).

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.VisualTransformPropertyType.Origin
member.summary: The origin of the visual within its control area.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.VisualTransformPropertyType.AnchorPoint
member.summary: The anchor-point of the visual.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.VisualTransformPropertyType.OffsetPolicy
member.summary: Whether the x or y offset values are relative (percentage [0.0f to 1.0f] of the control) or absolute (in world units).

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.VisualTransformPropertyType.SizePolicy
member.summary: Whether the width or the height size values are relative (percentage [0.0f to 1.0f] of the control) or absolute (in world units).

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.PanGesture
member.summary:
A PanGesture is emitted when the user moves one or more fingers in a particular direction.
A pan gesture will end in the following ways:
- User releases the primary finger (the first touch).
- User has more fingers on the screen than the maximum specified.
- User has less fingers on the screen than the minimum specified.
- Cancelled by the system.
A pan gesture will continue to be sent to the actor under than initial pan until it ends.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.PanGesture.Dispose(Tizen.NUI.DisposeTypes)
member.summary: Dispose.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.PanGesture.Velocity
member.summary:
The velocity at which the user is moving their fingers.
This is represented as a Vector2 and is the pixel movement per millisecond.
A positive x value shows that the user is panning to the right, a negative x value means the opposite.
A positive y value shows that the user is panning downwards, a negative y values means upwards.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.PanGesture.Displacement
member.summary:
This is a Vector2 showing how much the user has panned (dragged) since the last pan gesture or, if the gesture has just started, then the amount panned since the user touched the screen.
A positive x value shows that the user is panning to the right, a negative x value means the opposite.
A positive y value shows that the user is panning downwards, a negative y value means upwards.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.PanGesture.Position
member.summary: The current touch position of the primary touch point in local actor coordinates.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.PanGesture.ScreenVelocity
member.summary:
The velocity at which the user is moving their fingers.
This is represented as a Vector2 and is the pixel movement per millisecond.
A positive x value shows that the user is panning to the right, a negative x value means the opposite.
A positive y value shows that the user is panning downwards, a negative y values means upwards.
This value represents the screen coordinates.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.PanGesture.ScreenDisplacement
member.summary:
This is a Vector2 showing how much the user has panned (dragged) since the last pan gesture or, if the gesture has just started, then the amount panned since the user touched the screen.
A positive x value shows that the user is panning to the right, a negative x value means the opposite.
A positive y value shows that the user is panning downwards, a negative y value means upwards.
This value is in screen coordinates.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.PanGesture.ScreenPosition
member.summary: The current touch position of the primary touch point in screen coordinates.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.PanGesture.NumberOfTouches
member.summary: The total number of fingers touching the screen in a pan gesture.

member.summary: The constructor.

Returns the speed at which the user is moving their fingers.

member.returns: The speed of the pan (in pixels per millisecond).

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.PanGesture.GetDistance
member.summary:
Returns the distance the user has panned (dragged) since the last pan gesture or, if the gesture has just started, then the distance moved since the user touched the screen.
This is always a positive value.
member.returns: The distance, as a float, a user's finger has panned.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.PanGesture.GetScreenSpeed
member.summary:
Returns the speed at which the user is moving their fingers relative to screen coordinates.
This is the pixel movement per millisecond.
member.returns: The speed of the pan (in pixels per millisecond).

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.PanGesture.GetScreenDistance
member.summary:
Returns the distance the user has panned (dragged) since the last pan gesture in screen coordinates or, if the gesture has just started, then the distance in screen coordinates moved since the user touched the screen.
This is always a positive value.
member.returns: The distance, as a float, a user's finger has panned.

member.summary: Adds a control point.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Path.GenerateControlPoints(System.Single)
member.summary:
Automatic generation of control points. Generated control points which result in a smooth join between the splines of each segment.
The generating algorithm is as follows:
For a given knot point K[N], find the vector that bisects K[N-1],[N] and [N],[N+1].
Calculate the tangent vector by taking the normal of this bisector.
The in control point is the length of the preceding segment back along this bisector multiplied by the curvature.
The out control point is the length of the succeeding segment forward along this bisector multiplied by the curvature.
member.param: The curvature of the spline. 0 gives straight lines between the knots, negative values means the spline contains loops, positive values up to 0.5 result in a smooth curve, positive values between 0.5 and 1 result in looped curves where the loops are not distinct (i.e., the curve appears to be non-continuous), positive values higher than 1 result in looped curves.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Path.Sample(System.Single,Tizen.NUI.Vector3,Tizen.NUI.Vector3)
member.summary: Sample path at a given progress. Calculates the position and tangent at that point of the curve.
member.param: A floating point value between 0.0 and 1.0.
The interpolated position at that progress.
The interpolated tangent at that progress.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.PinchGesture
member.summary:
A PinchGesture is emitted when the user moves two fingers towards or away from each other.
A pinch gesture will continue to be sent to the actor under the center point of the pinch until the pinch ends.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.PinchGesture.Dispose(Tizen.NUI.DisposeTypes)
member.summary: Dispose.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.PinchGesture.Scale
member.summary:
The scale factor from the start of the pinch gesture till the latest pinch gesture.
If the user is moving their fingers away from each other, then this value increases. Conversely, if the user is moving their fingers towards each other, this value will decrease.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.PinchGesture.Speed
member.summary:
The speed at which the user is moving their fingers.
This is the pixel movement per second.

members.member:
The PixelBuffer object holds a pixel buffer. The PixelBuffer keeps ownership of it's initial buffer however, the user is free to modify the pixel data, either directly, or via image operations.
In order to upload the pixel data to texture memory, there are two possibilities - either convert it back to a PixelData object, which releases the PixelBuffer object, leaving the user with an empty handle (ideal for one-time indirect image manipulation), or create a new PixelData object from this object, leaving the buffer intact (ideal for continuous manipulation)
5 This will be released at Tizen.NET API Level 5, so currently this would be used as inhouse API.

Apply the mask to this pixel data, and return a new pixel data containing the masked image. If this PixelBuffer doesn't have an alpha channel, then the resultant PixelBuffer will be converted to a format that supports at least the width of the color channels and the alpha channel from the mask.
If cropToMask is set to true, then the contentScale is applied first to this buffer, and the target buffer is cropped to the size of the mask. If it's set to false, then the mask is scaled to match this buffer's size before the mask is applied.
The mask to apply. The scaling factor to apply to the content. Whether to crop the output to the mask size (true) or scale the mask to the content size (false). 5 This will be released at Tizen.NET API Level 5, so currently this would be used as inhouse API.

The PixelData object holds a pixel buffer.
The PixelData takes over the ownership of the pixel buffer.
The buffer memory must NOT be released outside of this class, instead, the PixelData object will release it automatically when the reference count falls to zero.
Please DO NOT use! This will be deprecated! PixelData class requires externally allocated pixel memory buffer and this buffer loses its ownershop by native DALi. And this would make some problem, because dotnet runtime would change the address of memory allocated. So this is required to be removed. currently no use. will be added later 5 This will be released at Tizen.NET API Level 5, so currently this would be used as inhouse API.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.StyleManager
member.summary:
The StyleManager informs applications of the system theme change, and supports application theme change at runtime.
Applies various styles to controls using the properties system.
On theme change, it automatically updates all controls, then raises a event to inform the application.
If the application wants to customize the theme, RequestThemeChange needs to be called.
It provides the path to the application resource root folder, from there the filename can be specified along with any subfolders, for example, Images, Models, etc.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.StyleManager.Instance
member.summary: Gets the singleton of the StyleManager object.

member.summary: Style changed event arguments.

member.summary: StyleManager.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.StyleManager.StyleChangedEventArgs.StyleChange
member.summary: StyleChange - contains the style change information (default font changed or default font size changed or theme has changed).

member.name: E:Tizen.NUI.StyleManager.StyleChanged
member.summary:
An event for the StyleChanged signal which can be used to subscribe or unsubscribe the event handler provided by the user.
The StyleChanged signal is emitted after the style (for example, theme or font change) has changed and the controls have been informed.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.StyleManager.#ctor
member.summary:
Creates a StyleManager handle.
This can be initialized with StyleManager::Get().

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.StyleManager.Get
member.summary: Gets the singleton of StyleManager object.
member.returns: A handle to the StyleManager control.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.StyleManager.ApplyTheme(System.String)
member.summary:
Applies a new theme to the application.
This will be merged on the top of the default Toolkit theme.
If the application theme file doesn't style all controls that the application uses, then the default Toolkit theme will be used instead for those controls.
member.param: A relative path is specified for style theme.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.StyleManager.ApplyDefaultTheme
member.summary: Applies the default Toolkit theme.

member.summary: Sets a constant for use when building styles.

member.summary: Returns the style constant set for a specific key.
member.param: The value of the constant if it exists.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.StyleManager.ApplyStyle(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Applies the specified style to the control.
member.param: The control to which to apply the style.
The name of the JSON style file to apply.
The name of the style within the JSON file to apply.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.TextureSet
member.summary:
TextureSet is a handle to an object that specifies the set of images used as textures by a renderer.
The images have to be ordered in the same order they are declared in the shader.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.Timer
member.summary:
Mechanism to issue simple periodic or one-shot events.
Timer is provided for application developers to be able to issue simple periodic or one-shot events. Please note that the timer callback functions should return as soon as possible because they block the next SignalTick. Please note that timer signals are not in sync with DALi's render timer.
This class is a handle class so it can be stack allocated and used as a member.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.Touch
member.summary:
Touch events are a collection of points at a specific moment in time.
When a multi-touch event occurs, each point represents the points that are currently being touched or the points where a touch has stopped.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Touch.Dispose(Tizen.NUI.DisposeTypes)
member.summary: Dispose.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Touch.#ctor
member.summary:
An uninitialized touch instance.
Calling member functions with an uninitialized touch handle is not allowed.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Touch.GetTime
member.summary: Returns the time (in ms) that the touch event occurred.
member.returns: The time (in ms) that the touch event occurred.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Touch.GetPointCount
member.summary: Returns the total number of points in this TouchData.
member.returns: The total number of points.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Touch.GetDeviceId(System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Returns the ID of the device used for the point specified.
Each point has a unique device ID, which specifies the device used for that point. This is returned by this method.
If a point is greater than GetPointCount(), then this method will return -1.
member.returns: The device ID of this point.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Touch.GetState(System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Retrieves the state of the point specified.
If a point is greater than GetPointCount(), then this method will return PointState.Finished.
member.returns: The state of the point specified.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Touch.GetHitView(System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Retrieves the actor that was underneath the point specified.
If a point is greater than GetPointCount(), then this method will return an empty handle.
member.returns: The actor that was underneath the point specified.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Touch.GetLocalPosition(System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Retrieves the coordinates relative to the top-left of the hit actor at the point specified.
The top-left of an actor is (0.0, 0.0, 0.5).
If you require the local coordinates of another actor (for example, the parent of the hit actor), then you should use Actor::ScreenToLocal().
If a point is greater than GetPointCount(), then this method will return Vector2.Zero.
member.returns: The coordinates relative to the top-left of the hit actor of the point specified.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Touch.GetScreenPosition(System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Retrieves the coordinates relative to the top-left of the screen of the point specified.
If a point is greater than GetPointCount(), then this method will return Vector2.Zero.
member.returns: The coordinates relative to the top-left of the screen of the point specified.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Touch.GetRadius(System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Retrieves the radius of the press point.
This is the average of both the horizontal and vertical radii of the press point.
If point is greater than GetPointCount(), then this method will return 0.0f.
member.returns: The radius of the press point.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Touch.GetEllipseRadius(System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Retrieves both the horizontal and the vertical radii of the press point.
If a point is greater than GetPointCount(), then this method will return Vector2.Zero.
member.returns: The horizontal and vertical radii of the press point.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Touch.GetPressure(System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Retrieves the touch pressure.
The pressure range starts at 0.0f.
Normal pressure is defined as 1.0f.
A value between 0.0f and 1.0f means light pressure has been applied.
A value greater than 1.0f means more pressure than normal has been applied.
If point is greater than GetPointCount(), then this method will return 1.0f.
member.returns: The touch pressure.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.UIComponents.Button
member.summary:
The Button class is a base class for different kinds of buttons.
This class provides the disabled property and the clicked signal.
The clicked event handler is emitted when the button is touched, and the touch point doesn't leave the boundary of the button.
When the disabled property is set to true, no signal is emitted.
The 'Visual' describes not just traditional images like PNG and BMP, but also refers to whatever is used to show the button. It could be a color, gradient, or some other kind of renderer.
The button's appearance can be modified by setting properties for the various visuals or images.
It is not mandatory to set all the visuals. A button could be defined only by setting its background visual, or by setting its background and selected visuals.
The button visual is shown over the background visual.
When pressed, the unselected visuals are replaced by the selected visuals.
The text label is always placed on the top of all images.
When the button is disabled, the background button and the selected visuals are replaced by their disabled visuals.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.UIComponents.CheckBoxButton
member.summary:
The CheckBoxButton provides a checkbox button which the user can check or uncheck.
By default, the CheckBoxButton emits a Button.Clicked event when the button changes its state to selected or unselected.
The button's appearance could be modified by Button.UnselectedImage, Button.BackgroundImage, Button.SelectedImage, Button.SelectedBackgroundImage, Button.DisabledBackgroundImage, Button.DisabledImage, and Button.DisabledSelectedImage.
When the button is not disabled, if it's not selected, it only shows the background image.
The selected image is shown over the background image when the box is selected (background image is not replaced by \e selected image).
When the button is disabled, the background image and the selected image are replaced by disabled images.
///

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.UIComponents.Popup.SetDisplayState(Tizen.NUI.UIComponents.Popup.DisplayStateType)
member.summary:
Sets the display state of popup.
There are 4 total display states.
Only 2 can be set, but all four can be read for better inspection of the current popup state.
The other two states are getable, but not setable, and are there for consistency.
| Value | Setting the state | Getting the state |
|----------|--------------------------------|--------------------------------|
| SHOWN | Show the popup | The popup is fully shown |
| HIDDEN | Hide the popup | The popup is fully hidden |
| SHOWING | | The popup is transitioning in |
| HIDING | | The popup is transitioning out |
All 4 states changes cause notifications via 4 respective signals that can be connected to.
member.param: The desired display state to change to.

member.summary: The display states of the popup.

member.summary: Creates the ProgressBar.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.UIComponents.ProgressBar.ProgressValue
member.summary:
The progress value of the progress bar, the progress runs from 0 to 1.
If the value is set to 0, then the progress bar will be set to beginning.
If the value is set to 1, then the progress bar will be set to end.
Any value outside the range is ignored.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.UIComponents.ProgressBar.SecondaryProgressValue
member.summary:
The secondary progress value of the progress bar, the secondary progress runs from 0 to 1.
Optional. If not supplied, the default is 0.
If the value is set to 0, then the progress bar will be set secondary progress to beginning.
If the value is set to 1, then the progress bar will be set secondary progress to end.
Any value outside of the range is ignored.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.UIComponents.ProgressBar.Indeterminate
member.summary: Sets the progress bar as \e indeterminate state.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.UIComponents.ProgressBar.TrackVisual
member.summary:
The track visual value of progress bar, it's full progress area, and it's shown behind the PROGRESS_VISUAL.
Optional. If not supplied, the default track visual will be shown.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.UIComponents.ProgressBar.ProgressVisual
member.summary:
The progress visual value of the progress bar, the size of the progress visual is changed based on the PROGRESS_VALUE.
Optional. If not supplied, then the default progress visual will be shown.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.UIComponents.ProgressBar.SecondaryProgressVisual
member.summary:
The secondary progress visual of the progress bar, the size of the secondary progress visual is changed based on the SECONDARY_PROGRESS_VALUE.
Optional. If not supplied, then the secondary progress visual will not be shown.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.UIComponents.ProgressBar.IndeterminateVisual
member.summary:
The indeterminate visual of the progress bar.
Optional. If not supplied, then the default indeterminate visual will be shown.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.UIComponents.ProgressBar.IndeterminateVisualAnimation
member.summary:
The transition data for the indeterminate visual animation.
Optional. If not supplied, then the default animation will be played.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.UIComponents.RadioButton
member.summary:
A RadioButton provides a radio button with two states, \e selected or \e unselected.
Radio buttons are designed to select one of the many options at the same time.
A RadioButton can change its current state using the selected.
RadioButtons can be grouped.
Two or more RadioButtons are in one group when they have this same parent.
In each groups only one RadioButton can be \e selected at a given time.
So when a RadioButton is set to \e selected, other RadioButtons in its group are set to \e unselected.
When \e selected RadioButton is set to \e unselected, no other RadioButtons in this group are set to \e selected.
The StateChanged event is emitted when the RadioButton change its state to \e selected or \e unselected.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ScrollView.SetViewAutoSnap(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Enables or Disables Actor Auto-Snap mode.
When Actor Auto-Snap mode has been enabled, ScrollView will automatically, snap to the closest actor (The closest actor will appear in the center of the ScrollView).

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ScrollView.SetWrapMode(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Enables or Disables Wrap mode for ScrollView contents.
When enabled, the ScrollView contents are wrapped over the X/Y Domain.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ScrollView.GetScrollUpdateDistance
member.summary: Gets the current distance needed to scroll for ScrollUpdatedSignal to be emitted.
member.returns: Current scroll update distance.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ScrollView.SetScrollUpdateDistance(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets the distance needed to scroll for ScrollUpdatedSignal to be emitted.
The scroll update distance tells ScrollView how far to move before ScrollUpdatedSignal the informs application.
Each time the ScrollView crosses this distance the signal will be emitted.
member.param: The distance for ScrollView to move before emitting update signal.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ScrollView.GetAxisAutoLock
member.summary: Returns state of Axis Auto Lock mode.
member.returns: Whether Axis Auto Lock mode has been enabled or not.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ScrollView.SetAxisAutoLock(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Enables or Disables Axis Auto Lock mode for panning within the ScrollView.
When enabled, any pan gesture that appears mostly horizontal or mostly vertical, will be automatically restricted to horizontal only or vertical only panning, until the pan gesture has completed.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ScrollView.GetAxisAutoLockGradient
member.summary: Gets the gradient threshold at which a panning gesture should be locked to the Horizontal or Vertical axis.
member.returns: The gradient, a value between 0.0 and 1.0f.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ScrollView.SetAxisAutoLockGradient(System.Single)
member.summary:
Sets the gradient threshold at which a panning gesture should be locked to the Horizontal or Vertical axis.
By default, this is 0.36 (0.36:1) which means angles less than 20 degrees to an axis will lock to that axis.
member.param: gradient A value between 0.0 and 1.0 (auto-lock for all angles).

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ScrollView.GetFrictionCoefficient
member.summary: Gets the friction coefficient setting for ScrollView when flicking in free panning mode. This is a value in stage-diagonals per second^2, stage-diagonal = Length( stage.width, stage.height )
member.returns: Friction coefficient is returned.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ScrollView.SetFrictionCoefficient(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the friction coefficient for ScrollView when flicking.
member.param: Friction coefficient must be greater than 0.0 (default = 1.0).

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ScrollView.GetFlickSpeedCoefficient
member.summary:
Gets the flick speed coefficient for ScrollView when flicking in free panning mode.
This is a constant which multiplies the input touch flick velocity to determine the actual velocity at which to move the scrolling area.
member.returns: The flick speed coefficient is returned.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ScrollView.SetFlickSpeedCoefficient(System.Single)
member.summary:
Sets the flick speed coefficient for ScrollView when flicking in free panning mode.
This is a constant which multiplies the input touch flick velocity to determine the actual velocity at which to move the scrolling area.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ScrollView.GetMinimumDistanceForFlick
member.summary: Gets the minimum pan distance required for a flick gesture in pixels.
member.returns: Minimum pan distance vector with separate x and y distance.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ScrollView.SetMinimumDistanceForFlick(Tizen.NUI.Vector2)
member.summary:
Sets the minimum pan distance required for a flick in pixels.
Takes a Vector2 containing separate x and y values. As long as the pan distance exceeds one of these axes, a flick will be allowed.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ScrollView.GetMinimumSpeedForFlick
member.summary: Returns the minimum pan speed required for a flick gesture in pixels per second.
member.returns: Minimum pan speed.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ScrollView.SetMinimumSpeedForFlick(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the minimum pan speed required for a flick in pixels per second.
member.param: The minimum pan speed for a flick.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ScrollView.GetMaxFlickSpeed
member.summary:
Gets the maximum flick speed setting for ScrollView when flicking in free panning mode.
This is a value in stage-diagonals per second.
member.returns: Maximum flick speed is returned.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ScrollView.SetMaxFlickSpeed(System.Single)
member.summary:
Sets the maximum flick speed for the ScrollView when flicking in free panning mode.
This is a value in stage-diagonals per second. stage-diagonal = Length( stage.width, stage.height ).

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.VisualBase
member.summary:
Sets whether the actor should be focusable by keyboard navigation.
Visuals reuse geometry, shader etc. across controls. They ensure that the renderer and texture sets exist only when control is on window.
Each visual also responds to actor size and color change, and provides clipping at the renderer level.

member.summary: Dispose.

member.summary: Creates an empty visual handle.

member.summary: Sets the transform and the control size.
member.param: A property map describing the transform.
The size of the parent control for visuals that need to scale internally.

member.summary: Returns the height for a given width.
member.returns: The height based on the width.

member.summary: Returns the width for a given height.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.VisualBase.GetNaturalSize(Tizen.NUI.Size2D)
member.summary:
Returns the natural size of the visual.
Deriving classes stipulate the natural size and by default a visual has a zero natural size.
A visual may not actually have a natural size until it has been placed on window and acquired all it's resources.
